alert.note: Alert for Lower Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Bucks County through 445 PM EDT... At 415 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Richboro, or 12 miles west of Trenton, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Doylestown, Newtown, Langhorne, Ivyland, Richboro, Feasterville-Trevose, Langhorn, Feasterville, Penndel, Langhorne Manor, Hulmeville, Churchville, Village Shires and Newtown Grant. This includes Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 347 and 351. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
